title.title: Ruislip station ticket office to close for two months

texts: In connection with ongoing station refurbishment works at Ruislip station as part of Transport for London's (TfL) 5-Year £10bn investment programme, the ticket office will close from 15 October until 10 December 2005.
Refurbishment works are scheduled to be completed by March 2006
Passengers will still be able to purchase tickets from ticket machines located in the station.
London Underground apologises for any inconvenience this may cause.

The refurbishment works presently being undertaken by Metronet Rail SSL include the restoration of heritage features, increased CCTV camera coverage, installation of customer Help Points, an enhanced public address system, new wall tiles, improved lighting, tactile strips on platforms and stairs along with contrasting handrails.
The whole station will also be painted and redecorated.
Refurbishment works are scheduled to be completed by March 2006.

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Transport for London (TfL) is investing £10bn over the next five years to improve and expand London's transport network, more than half of that in the Tube","Metronet Rail SSL are responsible for the maintenance and renewal of the Circle, District, Hammersmith \u0026 City, Metropolitan and East London lines\u003cbr /\u003e"]}
